metadata.title: CVE-2024-24856 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: The memory allocation function ACPI_ALLOCATE_ZEROED does not guarantee asuccessful allocation, but the subsequent code directly dereferences thepointer that receives it, which may lead to null pointer dereference.To fix this issue, a null pointer check should be added. If it is null,return exception code AE_NO_MEMORY.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
